result.execSummary:
The defendant Roberto D Garcia Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Roberto D Garcia Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Roberto D Garcia Jr was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
**AMENDED 3/1/2017 to reflect correct amount of credit for time served.**
Concurrent with: 15CF90

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply with family court orders. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Any assessments, counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Defendant Roberto D Garcia in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Roberto D Garcia in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Sharon Riek.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
State req bond be forfeited in 15CF996 and 15CF1476.

BTC:  Bonds are to be returned to poster.  Court will use PSI in 15CF90 for PLEAS.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim A.I.G. (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 5-17-2016:  No violent contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).**
Bail/bond hearing on May 26, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Roberto D Garcia in court with attorney Helmi Hamad and Erin Larsen.  Defendant Roberto D Garcia in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Tracking w/JT file

Defendant Roberto D Garcia in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Roberto D Garcia in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense is giving ADA Riek a copy of the affidavit previously provided to the former prosecutor. Parties MIL reviewed and granted. No 904.04 issues by the State. The Court will give preliminary instructions. Sgt. Jones is requested to be a representative of the State, which is granted. Parties witnesses are all available.  The trial is expected to last less than a day. The State asks for an alternate. 1 alternate, 5 strikes.

Defense has filed a bond motion and asks for contact with victim to be allowed for 15CF996 and 15CF1476. Defense asks for a condition of no violent contact. The State objects as victim is a trial witness.

BTC: JT remains. Bond modification as requested is denied.
ATTY Hamad files motion for modification of bond.

Defendant Roberto D Garcia in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Roberto D Garcia in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State indicates that there was a misunderstanding between the State and Mr. Hamad. The State does not have its officer here regarding the evidentiary motion. The State indicates that the motion to amended information can go forward. The Miranda/Goodchild motion wil be heard on January 5 prior to voir dire. Defense indicates that they did review motion to amend information and they do not object

BTC: The State may file an amended information. Miranda/Goodchild matter to be decided prior to voir dire. The Court enters pleas of NG on behalf of the defendant to the amended information.

Defendant Roberto D Garcia in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Roberto D Garcia in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for Sharon Riek for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The poster in 15CF90 & 15CF996, Ms. A Garcia wishes to be removed as poster of cash. Ms. Delery has not seen that letter. Mr. Hamad has filed a motion reducing the bond to $1,500.00 cash. Ms. A. Garcia is in court and the Court conducts a colloquy. Ms. A. Garcia withdraws her request. Defense indicates that Ms. Garcia is asking that no contact be amended to no violent contact. Defense indicates that deft needs an MRI on his knee. Defense indicates that doctor also wants a CAT scan on his stomach. Deft's Aunt will be his caregiver if modification of bond is granted. The State objects to the bond modifications as requested by defense - argument put on the record.

BTC: The Court takes no action on the letter from the poster on 15CF90 & 15CF996. In 15CF1476, the request for no violent contact is denied. In 15CF1476, bond modification is granted. Reduce bond to $2,500.00 cash.
ATTY Hamad files motion for modification of bail.
